meanings.definition: Feeling or showing bitterness or indignation at having been treated unfairly.
meanings.sent1: She was resentful when her friend forgot her birthday.
meanings.sent2: He felt resentful towards his boss for not giving him a raise.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked resentful when the dog got more attention.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed resentful of the sun's warmth.
meanings.sent5: The student's resentful expression spoke volumes about her feelings of injustice.

meanings.definition: Full of or marked by resentment.
meanings.sent1: The old man's eyes were resentful as he talked about his past.
meanings.sent2: The atmosphere in the room was tense and resentful after the argument.
meanings.sent3: The resentful tone in his voice made his apology insincere.
meanings.sent4: The resentful silence between them was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the resentful spirit of the abandoned house perfectly.
